ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Indicate how much you agree or disagree with the following: If I have any money left at the end of the pay period, I just have to spend it.
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Somewhat agree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Somewhat disagree; 5=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Indicate how often you have done each of the following: Felt others would be horrified if they knew of my spending habits.
Indicate how often you have done each of the following: Bought things even though I could not afford them.
Indicate how often you have done each of the following: Wrote a check when I knew I did not have enough money in the bank to cover it.
Indicate how often you have done each of the following: Bought myself something in order to make myself feel better.
Indicate how often you have done each of the following: Felt anxious or nervous on days I did not go shopping.
Indicate how often you have done each of the following: Made only the minimum payments on my credit cards.

Notes: A score less than or equal to -1.34 indicates subject is a compulsive buyer. Scoring equation is -9.69 plus the sum of (0.33*cbs_1), (0.34*cbs_2), (0.5*cbs_3), (0.47*cbs_4), (0.33*cbs_5), (0.38*cbs_6), and (0.31*cbs_7)
